statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Four Loyola Marymount players scored in double figures to lead the Lions past La Sierra 100-62 on Sunday.
article.headline: Drew Viney leads Loyola Marymount to first victory of season
article.linkText: Viney leads Loyola Marymount to first victory
article.story: LOS ANGELES -- Four Loyola Marymount players scored in double figures to lead the Lions past La Sierra 100-62 on Sunday. Drew Viney led LMU (1-1) with 14 points, eight rebounds, three assists and three steals. Ashley Hamilton scored 12 points for the Lions while Ayodeji Egbeyemi and Larry Davis added 10 each. The Lions, who led 51-25 at halftime, bounced back from an 81-79 home loss to Morgan State on Friday night. Godwin Okonji grabbed 10 rebounds for the Lions, who held a 52-26 edge on the boards, including 20 on the offensive glass. It was Loyola Marymount's highest rebounding total since getting 54 in a 2001 game against UNLV. Lavel Pickett led La Sierra, an NAIA school, with 15 points. The Lions made 33 of 43 free throws, with 11 players getting at least a point from the foul line.
